column4: hi, does anyone happen to know where python2.5 's libs are supposed to live in dapper? they seem to be in /usr/local/lib/python.2.5 but 2.4 was in /usr/lib/python2.4 (no /local/ )
/usr/local is stuff you installed without using the package manager
ah, oh yeah. i guess i installed 2.5 from a tarball, forgot. if 2.5 is in the repos now, would installing it from synaptic be extraordinarily bad, ray?
no, but your system will still prefer the one in /usr/local since /usr/local comes first in your PATH
that makes sense. thanks for your help
I would remove the /usr/local installation and use the repositories myself.  np
i'm looking to see if 2.5 has made it into the repo yet
I know it is in edgy, don't know about dapper
doesn't seem to be there, guess not yet.
no, you can just use gksu, no sudo
thanks... hmm,  i don't seem to have a .gtk-boomarks
for the record, I just crated a bookmark with a name like oiusdfaoiuds and grepped for it :)
